comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111104165243

Steps to reproduce:

Prereq.: "Force new links to open in tabs" is disabled.

1. Go to http://www.heise.de/newsticker/meldung/Was-war-Was-wird-1381845.html
2. Hold Ctrl-key
3. Click any external link (e.g. the one labeled "Pleiten und Pannen")


Actual results:

Link opens in a new window


Expected results:

Link opens in a new tab
comments.author: u430040@disabled.tld

comments.raw_text:
WFM with 3.6 and the latest nightly

Does the issue still occur if you start Firefox in Safe Mode? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

How about with a new, empty profile? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic%20Troubleshooting#w_8-make-a-new-profile
comments.creator: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com
comments.author: fmdevelopertim@gmail.com
comments.text:
WFM with 3.6 and the latest nightly

Does the issue still occur if you start Firefox in Safe Mode? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

How about with a new, empty profile? http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic%20Troubleshooting#w_8-make-a-new-profile

comments.raw_text:
Safemode -> yes, issue persists

New profile -> yes, issue persists (if the "force ..." settings is unchecked)
comments.creator: u430040@disabled.tld
comments.author: u430040@disabled.tld
comments.text:
Safemode -> yes, issue persists

New profile -> yes, issue persists (if the "force ..." settings is unchecked)

I can confirm the problem with FF8.0 on win7 and the default setting "opening new windows in tabs instead" changed to disabled

Reporter: Do you know if this worked in previous Firefox versions ?
I will do a regression search in that case or otherwise search harder for a dupe bug

Tim: Did you changed the default setting as you tested with the latest nightly ?
I have only Seamonkey nightly for testing and SM isn't comparable with such UI features.
comments.author: bugzilla@mversen.de
